0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Postoperative nausea and vomiting: 50 mg (0.5-1 mg/kg) IM 15min prior to emergence from anesthesia, may be repeated in 1hr, then every 3-4hrs as needed

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• do not administer intravenously to patients with cardiovascular disease or with cardiovascular drugs
  • may mask symptoms of drug overdose
  • may obscure diagnosis of intestinal obstruction or central nervous system tumors
  • not recommended for use in children

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Benzquinamide: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Benzquinamide: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Abnormal blood pressure
  • Dermatologic:Rash
  • Gastrointestinal:Loss of appetite, Salivation finding, Xerostomia
  • Neurologic:Dystonia, Shivering, Somnolence
Serious
Cardiovascular:Cardiac dysrhythmia

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    not recommended for IV administration
  • Intramuscular
    reconstitute 50 mg vial with 2.2 mL Sterile Water for Injection to achieve 50 mg/2mL

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause loss of appetite, salivation, xerostomia, dystonia, shivering, or somnolence.
  • Tell patient to report signs/symptoms of cardiac dysrhythmias.
